candidates.name: Riya Sharma
candidates.linkedin_summary: AI/ML enthusiast with internships in computer vision and NLP. Comfortable with Python, PyTorch, scikit-learn, pandas, and deploying small Flask services. Built LLM prompt engineering experiments for RAG prototypes.

work_history.title: Computer Vision Intern
work_history.description: Trained CNNs and fine-tuned vision transformers for defect detection; collaborated with teammates; documented results.
work_history.impact: Improved F1 by 7% and reduced inference cost by 15%

work_history.title: NLP Research Intern
work_history.description: Built text classifiers; prompt engineering for LLM; created FastAPI service; wrote unit tests.
work_history.impact: Shipped an API used by 3 internal teams

repos.name: cv-defects
repos.description: Image defect detection with transfer learning

repos.name: rag-lab
repos.description: RAG pipeline with vector store and prompt engineering

candidates.name: Arjun Verma
candidates.linkedin_summary: Data generalist: sklearn, XGBoost, SQL; strong with data pipelines. Some Docker + MLOps. Built dashboards and model monitoring.

work_history.title: ML Intern
work_history.description: Implemented feature store; optimized XGBoost; mentored juniors; wrote docs.

work_history.title: Junior ML Engineer
work_history.description: Own ETL pipelines; deployed models with Docker + CI; collaborated with stakeholders.

transcripts.cand_001: I like to clarify requirements early and keep the team in the loop. When a training job failed, I paired with a teammate to debug and document the root cause. I appreciate feedback and present tradeoffs clearly.
transcripts.cand_002: I usually organize stakeholders, communicate risks, and design incremental rollouts. When pipelines were late, I avoided blame and focused on solutions with the team. I listen and respect deadlines.
